content:
.
Fact # 3: The original disciples suddenly came to believe in the resurrection of Jesus
despite having every predisposition to the contrary. Jews had no belief in a dying,
much less a rising, Messiah, and Jewish beliefs about the afterlife precluded
anyone’s rising from the dead prior to the end of the world. Luke Johnson, a
New Testament scholar at Emory University, muses, “Some sort of powerful, 
transformative experience is required to generate the sort of movement earliest
Christianity was
